summary: This document is a set of 30-minute check sheets for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 10, 2019. The sheets record scheduled inmate observation rounds for multiple tiers (G, H, J, K, L, M) and are reviewed by lieutenants and a captain, documenting standard prison security protocol on the day Jeffrey Epstein died.

persons.name: Morning Watch Lieutenant
persons.context: The officer who reviewed the check sheets for the morning watch shift. Their signature is required on the document.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: The senior officer who reviewed the completed check sheets, as indicated at the bottom of each page.

persons.name: Day Watch Lieutenant
persons.context: The officer responsible for the day watch shift operations, listed on the form's header.

persons.name: Evening Watch Lieutenant
persons.context: The officer responsible for the evening watch shift operations, listed on the form's header.

events.title: SHU Inmate Monitoring
events.description: Standard 30-minute observational checks of inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York were conducted and documented throughout the day.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a prison log showing 30-minute observational checks for inmates in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York.
The date of the log is August 10, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at this facility.
The log covers multiple tiers (G, H, J, K, L, M) within the SHU, indicating it was a standard procedure log for the unit.
The document specifies the protocol requiring staff to observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The forms were reviewed by shift lieutenants and a captain, documenting chain of command oversight of inmate monitoring.
